title: Newtons second law - comparing two half-Atwoods

content.question: A hanging block of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> is connected to an identical block of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> on a horizontal surface with negligible friction by a light cord over an ideal pulley, as shown. When the blocks are released, the magnitude of the acceleration of each block is <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math>. If the block on the surface is replaced with a block of mass <math alttext="5 M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mi>M</mi></math>, what will be the magnitude of the acceleration of each block after the blocks are released?
